result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam C. Leathers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 per month payment plan commencing on or before June 5, 2015

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam C. Leathers

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam C. Leathers in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR114 tracking together:
Court questions the defendant.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant does not want to get an Attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Return and Pre-trial date.
bond continued.

Atty Hendee states that he can have a pre-trial today if the court allows.  Defendant would like to meet with the DA.
BY THE COURT:  Recess

BACK ON THE RECORD:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 and moves to dismiss 15TR114.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
Pay fine and costs = $442.00
15TR114 to be dismissed.

Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in June
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.

Defendant Adam C. Leathers in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  Return date scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
15TR114 is tracking w/15CM37 per DA's Office
